sen.j: 伊香具神社（いかぐじんじゃ）は、滋賀県伊香郡木之本町大音にある神社である。
sen.e: Ikagu-jinja Shrine is the shrine that exists in Oto, Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
Ikagu-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Oto, Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
Ikagu-jinja Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Oto, Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 式内社名神大社である。
sen.e: It is a Shikinaisha Myojin Taisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).
It is a Shikinaisha Myojin Taisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).
It is a Shikinaisha Myojin Taisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws).

sen.j: 『三代実録』には、貞観 (日本)元年に従四位下の神階を賜ったとの記述がある湖北随一の名社である。
sen.e: It is the most prestigious shrine in Kohoku (area north of Lake Biwa) that has the description in "Sandaijitsuroku" that the shrine was given shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

It is the most prestigious shrine in Kohoku (area north of Lake Biwa), that is described in "Sandaijitsuroku" as being given shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 859.

It is the most prestigious shrine in Kohoku (area north of Lake Biwa), that is described in "Sandaijitsuroku" as being given shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 859.

sen.j: 2月24日にオコナイが催される。

sen.e: In old classification of shrine it was a prefectural shrine.
In old classification of shrine it was a prefectural shrine.
In old classification of shrine it was a prefectural shrine.

sen.j: 近江国風土記逸文中の羽衣伝説に登場する「伊香刀美」と同一であるという。
sen.e: It is said that the deity is the same as 'Ikatomi' that appears in the Robe of Feathers Legend of itsubun (surviving fragment of the document) of fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Omi Province.

It is said that the deity is the same as 'Ikatomi' that appears in the Robe of Feathers Legend of itsubun (surviving fragment of the document) of fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Omi Province.

It is said that the deity is the same as 'Ikatomi' that appears in the Robe of Feathers Legend of itsubun (surviving fragment of the document) of fudoki (description of regional climate, culture, etc.) of Omi Province.
